snippet: Immigrants identified under a federal fingerprinting program as possibly in the country illegally were arrested again on more than 1,800 serious offenses, a report found.
abstract: Congressional Research Service report finds immigrants identified under federal fingerprinting program as possibly in the country illegally were arrested again on more than 1,800 serious offenses; charges included 19 murders, 3 attempted murders and 142 sex crimes.
lead_paragraph: Immigrants identified under a federal fingerprinting program as possibly in the country illegally were arrested again on more than 1,800 serious offenses, a report found.

headline.seo: Report Finds Repeated Arrests of Immigrants Flagged by Fingerprint Checks
headline.main: Program Tracks Arrests in Group of Immigrants
headline.print_headline: Program Tracks Arrests In Group of Immigrants
